intro: Sebastiania corniculata var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf sebastiania, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its unique floral structures and milky sap. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers with prominent yellow cyathia. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
